climbs.name: Wankan Eye
climbs.fa: FA: David Sharratt, SA: Morgan Patterson

content.description: Climbs center of overhanging face over the eye like feature using small crimps.

Traverse from lower left side, around corner and up across the top of the overhanging face. If you are facing the boulder looking down hill walk around left to hanging corner, start with decent hold and heel hooking to move uphill around the boulder and topout above Wankan Eye.

A really fun climb, great movement, with a committing finish.  As you see from the photos, the FA on this was done without a crash pad and in Asolo boots, not climbing shoes.  Start on positive holds and head up and right towards a RH crimp and a series of finger locks. Trend back left to finish on slopers, its not over until its over.  Note:  If you fall up here without pads you'll probably get real banged up.  So bring pads if your climbing anywhere even close to your max effort. And be sure to enjoy the splendor of the place.
content.location: Right off the Glen Boulder Trail

content.description: Glen Boulder, visible to travelers on Route 16, is a glacial erratic curiously perched on the Presidental Ridge in Pinkham Notch. There are also a few problems located in the Boulders in the parking lot, I recall one hard project too probably V9ish or so.
